channel.title: Hidden Rules in ToL
channel.description:
I have recently learned that a Healer is confirmed, and that only 2 of a class can appear in the game. The game did not tell me any of this.
There should be no hidden rules. It gives players an unfair advantage if they know something others don't. I don't see any problem with this being explained anyways. Players will learn, so hiding them won't do anything.
I see no reason to hide these rules. Players need to understand how the game works, and this hinders that.
These should be made common knowledge, and also shown by the class cards, class list, etc.\ For example, put 1+ Physician/Alchemist on the class list, since it is guaranteed.
I see no reason to keep this hidden.

item.title: Hidden Rules in ToL
item.dc:creator: Wolfy
item.description:
The two classes maximum is not a hidden rule. If you play the game and click on the Guide tab and read the section that says “Setup” in the Basics tab, it does say, and I quote fully

“A max of two of each non-unique class can spawn at the start of a game”.

I guess it should state that there should be a guaranteed healer/confirmed healer, but as Nuclear said, there should likely be some kind of healer anyway, whether they be Alche or Physician.
